meanings.definition: Charm or enchant (someone), sometimes in a deceptive way.
meanings.sent1: The magician used his tricks to beguile the audience.
meanings.sent2: She tried to beguile him with her sweet smile.
meanings.sent3: The sly fox tried to beguile the chickens with promises of safety.
meanings.sent4: The con artist would beguile unsuspecting victims with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody seemed to beguile all who heard it.

meanings.sent1: The scammer attempted to beguile the elderly couple out of their savings.
meanings.sent2: He used his wit to beguile his opponents in the game.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to beguile his friends with a fake treasure map.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could beguile even the most skeptical of individuals.
meanings.sent5: The illusionist's performance was so captivating, it seemed to beguile reality itself.

meanings.sent1: To beguile the long journey, she read a captivating book.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful scenery helped beguile the hours as they drove.
meanings.sent3: The engaging conversation served to beguile the monotony of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The soothing music was able to beguile the restless baby to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The delightful aroma of freshly baked cookies seemed to beguile everyone in the house.
